title: Lady Gaga and David Beckham meet in bizarre teaser for watch advert
text:
They're two of the biggest stars in the world.

And Lady Gaga joined David Beckham for a teaser clip from their new advert with Tudor Watch, which saw them introduce each other as they met for the first time.

In the short video, which was released on Wednesday, the professional footballer, 44, and pop star, 33, exchanged pleasantries as they decided how to refer to each other.

Friendly: David Beckham and Lady Gaga met and exchanged pleasantries for the first time in bizarre teaser for watch advert, which was released on Wednesday

Ever the gentleman, David began: 'and how would you like me to address you?'

The Joanne hitmaker responded: 'I guess Gaga or Lady,' to which the sportsman said: 'Lady, lady it is.'

Lady Gaga then referred to David as 'Mr. Beckham', but the footballer told her that 'David is more than fine.'

The video then concluded as she said, 'David, okay good.'

Pleasantries: Ever the gentleman, David began: 'and how would you like me to address you?' and she said he could call her 'Gaga or Lady'

Fans were besides themselves with excitement over the glimpse of the advert, as they took to Twitter to gush about the pair.

One excited user wrote: 'Lady Gaga and David Beckham? A DREAM. Literally a dream.'

While another gushed: 'LADY GAGA AND DAVID BECKHAM ARE IN A COMMERCIAL TOGETHER?!?! (sic)'

Some fans even went on to joke that David would appear on Lady Gaga's new album LG6, with one even jokingly claim that her album would be named after him.

Delighted: Fans were besides themselves with excitement over the glimpse of the advert, as they took to Twitter to gush about the pair

It's been a troublesome month for David and his wife of over twenty years Victoria following David's driving ban.

Earlier this month, Bromley Magistrates Court ruled that David would be banned from driving for six months after receiving another six points on his driving licence, when a member of the public spotted him using a phone whilst driving.

Since the star already had six points on his licence for separate speeding offences, a total of twelve meant he would be banned from driving for six months.
